title: This Will Be A BIG WEEK FOR CRYPTO!! Watch This NOW!!

chunks.text: What's up, guys? It's Dan from Coin Bureau Trading. Today, we're going to talk about why this week is going to be a big week for the crypto market. If this is the kind of content that you enjoy, then be sure to smash that like button, subscribe to the channel, and ping that notification bell. Before we get started, do keep in mind that nothing in this video is financial advice. It's just my personal analysis of the crypto market. Your analysis could be different. And if it is, that's awesome because the more difference of opinion that we have, the better traders and the better investors we're all going to become. So, the first reason guys why this week is going to be crazy for crypto uh has to do uh with of course the Department of Justice announcing that it's investigating Fed Chairman Jerome Pal. Of course, you guys will know that the Trump administration has basically been trying to take control of the Federal Reserve. And what's really interesting is that crypto prices actually rallied on the news and that suggests to me that later today once US markets open, we're probably going to see a continuation higher in the crypto market as people see crypto as kind of being like a, you know, a currency that's independent of the Federal Reserve and independent of these politics. even though that's not technically true, but uh we'll get more into the impacts this is having on the market in just a second. Uh the second catalyst to keep in mind uh tomorrow we're going to be getting the CPI print for December. Uh I do think that the inflation print the CPI will come in lower than expected simply because oil prices and rental prices fell uh in December compared to November. And if you guys follow a true uh it's a kind of this crypto project that tracks inflation in real time, they are already showing inflation being below 2%. So, the CPI should come in significantly lower than expected. Investors are expecting 2.7%. It'll probably come in way lower than expected. Uh, as a fun fact, guys, you might know that I had predicted that the previous CPI print would come in lower than expected based on oil prices and rental prices. Uh, the previous CPI from November. Um, you can go back and check that if you want to verify that, but when it comes to analyzing inflation, in my opinion, it's pretty simple. Just look at oil prices and rental prices in the US and the previous month, and that'll tell you roughly which way inflation is going to go. Uh anyways, the third uh catalyst of course guys to keep in mind here is one that was was actually supposed to happen uh last week and that was basically the Supreme Court probably striking down Trump's tariffs that was expected to be announced last Friday and it was basically pushed to this Wednesday so January 14th which means that again today we have basically this whole scuffle with the Fed that's probably going to be all over the news probably going to result in some inflows into crypto as of this narrative that you know well we're already seeing also gold and everything rally right uh where people are saying oh we're going to diversify into assets that are not politicized or whatever, right? Not the US dollar. Then we have the CPI that's likely to come in lower than expected, which should actually increase the chances that the Fed is going to cut rates. And then we have the Supreme Court likely to strike down Trump's tariffs. Of course, uh I think the Trump administration has already said that they might introduce tariffs in a different way. Um so it's going to be interesting to see how that impacts the market. Um but in the short term, if those tariffs are struck down, then basically the combination of all three of these factors should cause the US dollar to fall. And of course, as you guys know, the US dollar is basically inversely correlated to the crypto market. So when the US dollar goes up, the crypto market tends to go down. And when the US dollar goes down, the crypto market tends to go up. What we're looking at here is the US dollar index on the 4hour chart. And you can see every single time the dollar index got overbought on the 4hour chart going back over the last few months or even few years. Every single time it gets overbought in the short term, it enters kind of like a short-term downtrend that lasts for about, you know, about a week or two.

This is the total crypto market cap, by the way. Uh basically, over the summer of last year, of course, we did see roughly like something like 3 months or four months below this key level. And then we saw that again happen in the spring of 2025. And then for the last couple of months here, we've been below the Ballinger band moving average on the weekly again. And what I basically uh proposed is like, you know, it's possible that we're seeing history repeat in the sense that we're going to get a rally, let's say, in the next couple of weeks back up to the Ballingerband moving average here on the weekly. And I'll show you what that means for each crypto individually in just a second. Um, but in the next basically week or two, we should see a rally back up to this level. And at that point, we can say, okay, are prices going to get rejected from that level and then enter a bare market or will prices break above that level and continue heading higher? For Ethereum, that would mean a rally somewhere up to 3,600. Uh, and for Salana, that would be a rally somewhere up to around 170, which would actually be a pretty sizable move. And assuming the debate goes well, then we should see prices rallying uh during the debate and then also after uh the Clarity Act becomes law. And I'm sure a lot of people will say, "Oh, it's going to be priced in or it's already priced in." The thing is guys that it's not really possible to to price in a structural change to the crypto market, right? We're not dealing with just like something that oh uh the government is buying Bitcoin or whatever. We're dealing with a fundamental shift to how the crypto market is is treated. Same way with the Genius Act, like introducing stable coin regulations. Uh you know, you can't really price that in because you don't know like how many banks are going to get involved. What does this mean in terms of how big crypto stable coins are going to grow? Um you know, what does this mean for certain chains? That's something that's very hard for the markets to price in. And I think that's exactly why we saw such a big rally heading into the Genius Act being uh approved and then the rally continued even after the Genius Act was approved because people are starting to understand and starting to speculate on how big this could be because you are dealing with a fundamental shift to how stable coins are treated in the United States. And we're about to see the same thing happen here with the Clarity Act.
